title: Hoop on ramp - speed vs radius

content.question: In an experiment, students roll several hoops down the same incline plane. Each hoop has the same mass but a different radius. Each hoop rolls down the incline without slipping. Which of the following graphs best shows the linear speed <math alttext="v" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Î½</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of the hoops at the bottom of the incline as a function of the radius <math alttext="r" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of the hoop?

choices.label: The figure presents the graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with horizontal axis labeled r, and vertical axis labeled V. The origin is labeled O. The line begins a little more than halfway up the vertical axis, and moves horizontally to the right.

The figure presents the graph of a straight line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with horizontal axis labeled r, and vertical axis labeled V. The origin is labeled O. The line begins a little more than halfway up the vertical axis, and moves downward and to the right.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in the r V plane, with origin labeled O. The curve starts high above the horizontal axis and slightly to the right of the vertical axis and moves downward and to the right. It continues downward and to the right until it flattens out and moves horizontally to the right until it ends slightly above the horizontal axis.

content.answer: The figure presents the graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with horizontal axis labeled r, and vertical axis labeled V. The origin is labeled O. The line begins a little more than halfway up the vertical axis, and moves horizontally to the right.
